title: Supratherapeutic INR
body:
**ACCP treatment guidelines for managing supratherapeutic INR (2012, 9th ed)** | INR | Therapeutic Intervention | | ----------: | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | ≤10 | **_If no bleeding:_** Hold coumadin. Restart when INR is therapeutic | | >10 | **_If no bleeding:_** Hold coumadin. Give oral vitamin K (2.5 mg) | | Major bleed | Hold coumadin. Give vitamin K (5-10 mg slow IVP), 4-factor PCC (FFP not of added benefit with 4-factor PCC) | **Higher bleeding risk associated with coumadin** - NSAIDS: non-selective and COX-2 selective - Antiplatelet agents: aspirin, clopidogrel - Clotrimoxazole - Antibiotics (especially fluoroquinolones) **Pearl** - Risk of intracranial hemorrhage doubles for every 1-point increase in INR ## Causes for supratherapeutic INR >6 [Hylek et al. JAMA 1998 study](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9496982) - Retrospective case-control study of patients with INR >6 - Enrolled 93 cases, 196 controls
